name: Classic Songs From Classic Singers (Not Rock) Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Frank Sinatra's legendary "One For My Baby", what is the name of the bartender?
questions.explanation:
Joe.

	"So, set 'em up, Joe, I've got a little story that you ought to know". One of Sinatra's best-known songs.

questions.text: In Doris Day's "Young at Heart", she speaks of living until what age?
questions.explanation:
105.

	"So, if you should survive till a hundred and five, think of all you derive out of being alive." (Yes, I know Sinatra did it, too.)

questions.text: In "Misty", Johnny Mathis refers to what kind of animal?
questions.explanation:
Kitten.

	"I'm as helpless as a kitten up a tree". This may be Johnny's most popular song.

questions.text: In " Rock-a-bye", Judy Garland refers to which of the following?
questions.explanation:
River.

	"A million baby kisses I'll deliver if you will only sing that Swanee River". She took the Al Jolson hit and made it her own.

questions.text: Which of the following does Nat "King" Cole NOT refer to in "Those Lazy Hazy Crazy Days of Summer"?
questions.explanation:
Potato Chips.

	"Those days of soda and pretzels and beer". He had such a smooth voice and delivery.

questions.text: In "Second Hand Rose", what is the occupation of Barbra Streisand's "boyfriend"?
questions.explanation:
Plumber.

	"Even Jake the plumber - he's the man I adore". Early Streisand favorite.

questions.text: What is the name of Liza Minnelli's friend in "Cabaret"?
questions.explanation:
Elsie.

	"I made my mind up back in Chelsea when I go I'm going like Elsie." Talk about belting out a song ...

questions.text: What city does Dean Martin refer to in "That's Amore"?
questions.explanation:
Naples.

	"Pardon me, but you see, down in Old Napoli, that's amore". "when the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie ..."

questions.text: According to Sammy Davis in "Candy Man', which of the following is edible?
questions.explanation:
Dishes.

	"You can even eat the dishes". One of his biggest hits.

questions.text: In "If I Ruled the World", Tony Bennett says that every day would be ...?
questions.explanation:
The first day of spring.

	"if I ruled the world every day would be the first day of spring". It's not ""San Francisco", but it's nice.
